Sentencas: The most commonly used solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode material is a two phase nickel and yttria stabilized zirconia (Ni/YSZ) cermet.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: During typical fuel cell operation, this material remains a cermet; however, the anode may reoxidize in a commercial SOFC system due to seal leakage, fuel supply interruption, or system shutdown.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The cyclic reduction and oxidation (redox) of nickel will result in large bulk volume changes, which may have a significant effect on the integrity of interfaces within the fuel cell and thus may cause significant performance degradation.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: A baseline of the redox behaviour of an anode-supported SOFC was developed using electrochemical testing and electron microscopy.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: During redox tests, the cell's initial performance was characterized and then a small amount of air was blown over the anode in order to reoxidize the cell.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The cell was then reduced and the electrochemical performance was remeasured in order to determine the amount of redox degradation.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Cell performance decreased slightly after each redox cycle, especially for redox times greater than 1 hour.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The microstructural changes that occurred after redox cycling were characterized using scanning and transmission electron microscopy (SEM and TEM).
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Redox cycling significantly changed the microstructure of the anode substrate in the cell.
Titulo: Electrochemical and microstructural characterization of the redox tolerance of solid oxide fuel cell anodes
